page.title: 09AIRDRIE'S NEW HOSPICE 1
page.content: THERE IS A SMALL NURSING HOME IN AIRDRIE CALLED ASSUMPTION HOUSE. THE SISTERS OF CHARITY WHO WORK THERE, DECIDED THAT AS IT WAS TOO SMALL AIRDRIE AND ITS NEIGHBOURING TOWNS NEEDED A HOSPICE- AND SO THE PROJECT BEGAN. THE TOWN COUNCIL HAS LEASED THE SITE OF THE HOSPICE TO THE SISTERS FOR 99 YEARS. THE MONEY FOR THE BUILDING AND EQUIPMENT IS BEING SUPPLIED BY THE ORDINARY PEOPLE. THE CHARITY DRIVES ARE CO-ORDINATED BY A COMMITTEE WHOSE CHAIRMAN IS BOBBY WATSON EX-PLAYER OF GLASGOW RANGERS FOOTBALL TEAM AND EX- MANAGER OF AIRDRIONIANS F.C. AT THIS MOMENT Â£1,000,000 IS NEEDED STILL. THE HOSPICE WILL PROVIDE THIRTY PLACES FOR PATIENTS OF ALL DENOMINATIONS.IT WILL COME UNDER THE AUSPICES OF THE NATIONAL HEALTH SERVICE BUT WITH 3 PRIVATE BEDS.
